WRITING.TITLE: I want to challenge my sci-fi writers' group to tell a space-based tale that takes place somewhere other than on a planet or in a ship. What are some options I can give them, if they need inspiration?

WRITING.TEXT: The point is not to be "super deep." Few of the movies Rian suggested would be considered "super deep." But those films tell a particular flavor of story. Watch a few of them.

WRITING.TITLE: Did people of the American "Wild West" drink hard apple cider instead of beer?
WRITING.TEXT: I read [this article](http://www.smithsonianmag.com/arts-culture/real-johnny-appleseed-brought-applesand-booze-american-frontier-180953263/) about Johnny Appleseed that implied the drink of choice of the American West during the 1800s was not beer at all, as we see in every saloon depicted in the movies. It's hard for me to envision a rough-and-tumble frontiersman leaning on the bar and ordering a hard apple cider. Can this be true?
I approve of your collection!
Great endorsement!
Good tip.

WRITING.TITLE: What do you know about Frost Mora knives? They are inexpensive but have stellar ratings at Amazon. Some reviewers there say these are BiFL. Yet so cheap?

WRITING.TEXT: So why USAA?
I was given an Invictus as a gift. How would you rate that brand?

I am completely dejected every time a race starts behind a safety car, because it eliminates what is often the most exciting lap of the race. Not every race can be thrilling, I know, but nearly every time the safety car drives around and around for three or four laps to start the race, what happens next is boring.
If you ever watch American-style football, either college or pro, you'll see that complaining about the commentators is half the fun.

WRITING.TITLE: Are homes with 10-foot ceilings harder to heat and cool than homes with traditional 8- or 9-foot ceilings, if all other factors are equal (square footage, insulation, et cetera)?

WRITING.TEXT: Thank you for the info!
Thanks for the info!
Ha, this thread isn't leaving many brand names that are trustworthy. What's a consumer to do?
What is your opinion of Henry? I have heard my father speak very highly of his Golden Boy .22.
I think the Bear stuff gets a bad rap from the hardcore crowd. Remember, that stuff is made to sell at Walmart to fans of his shows, rather than at high-end shops to gear heads.
I can't speak for Craftsman power tools, but their hand tools have never failed me.
Thanks. I'll give it a try if you can vouch for it. I'm just sort of overwhelmed by the number of those products on the market, each one sounding a little bit too good to be true.

WRITING.TITLE: Should I use an engine additive?
WRITING.TEXT: I drive a beautiful 2007 Chevy shortbed, and she just rolled over 100K miles. I see a lot of ads for engine additives, fuel treatments, and oil stabilizers. Does any of that stuff actually extend the life of my truck? If so, how do I know where to start, with so much on the market?
That's cool! But it's probably because a sponsor was paying for it. As they say in POLICE ACADEMY, "In America, talk is cheap!"
Um, this America. We are built on commercials.

As an American, my F1 experience is brought to me weekly by Leigh Diffey, David Hobbs, and Steve Matchett, and I find their commentary far superior to what I've seen here when watching NBA, NFL, NHL, et cetera.
True. I heard the term applied in RPGs long ago.
We have a word for those types of players: munchkins.
I'm not that guy in real life, but only in the classroom. ; )
You are not alone.
It's Allan with an "A" and not "Allen" with an "E," as I say about 22 times each semester.

I realize that tone is difficult to convey in text, but OP wasn't seriously calling everyone crazy. Relax. If you're so easily offended, I'd hate to see how you react when someone genuinely insults you.
I for one admit that I'm a wee bit crazy.
Don't worry about it. Some people take things too seriously and have a hard time making fun of themselves. I've seen enough beekeepers to know that we're an odd group, for sure.
I'm sorry, but how will messaging function via Skype?
I don't think OP was meaning to insult anyone.
